[![pypi](https://img.shields.io/pypi/v/django-include-by-ajax.svg)](https://pypi.python.org/pypi/django-include-by-ajax/)# A Django App Providing the `{% include_by_ajax %}` Template Tag## The ProblemStart pages usually show data aggregated from different sections. To render a start page might take some time if the relations and filters are complex or if there are a lot of images. The best practice for performance is to display the content above the fold (in the visible viewport area) as soon as possible, and then to load the rest of the page dynamically by JavaScript.## The SolutionThis app allows you to organize heavy pages into sections which are included in the main page template. The default including can be done by the `{% include template_name %}` template tag and it is rendered immediately. We are introducing a new template tag `{% include_by_ajax template_name %}` which will initially render an empty placeholder, but then will load the content by Ajax dynamically.The template included by `{% include_by_ajax template_name %}` will get all the context that would normally be passed to a normal `{% include template_name %}` template tag.You can also pass a placeholder template which will be shown until the content is loaded.
